page.title: 14Personal Beliefs
page.content: I do not necessarily believe in any deity.I prefer to adopt the Pascalian viewpoint and keep an open mind on the subject.However,we are all prisoners of our time and the product of our family backgrounds and social environments.Mine are Welsh working class and Calvinistic Methodist so in many ways I had more difficulties in coping with the challenge of the rel_ tively free and open environment of university.There was an awkward period of adjustment during which I was forced to work out a whole new set of criteria in order to cope with the demands and responsibilities of life.This process has continued ever since based upon a healthy scepticism and spirit of toleration. In 1985,I am most concerned about the threat to world peace,help for poor countries and an end to torture.
